brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate and compare the Pharmacokinetics/Pharmacodynamics
      and safety of Remimazolam Tosylate with midazolam in  healthy volunteers

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase Ⅰa Study of Remimazolam Tosylate in Healthy Volunteers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy males or females

          -  Weight range 50 to 100 kg inclusive

          -  Body mass index (BMI) 18 to 26 kg/m2

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Has a known sensitivity to benzodiazepines, flumazenil, or anesthetic agents, or a
             medical condition such that these agents are contraindicated

          -  With evidence of uncontrolled renal, hepatic, central nervous system, respiratory,
             cardiovascular, or metabolic dysfunction, in the opinion of the investigator or
             medical monitor

          -  Has known or suspected history of alcoholism or drug abuse or misuse within 6 months
             of Screening or evidence of tolerance or physical dependence before dosing with study
             drug

          -  With a history of laboratory results that show the presence of hepatitis B surface
             antigen (HBs Ag), hepatitis C antibody (HCV Ab), or human immunodeficiency virus
             (HIV)

          -  Pregnant,lactating

          -  Mallampati score ≥3

clinical_study.official_title: A Placebo- and Midazolam-Controlled, Phase Ia, Single Ascending-Dose Study Evaluating the Safety, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of Remimazolam Tosylate

primary_outcome.measure: To study the Pharmacokinetics of Remimazolam Tosylate by assessment of drug concentration through blood sample analysis
Bispectral index (BIS) and Modified Observer's Assessment of Alertness/Sedation(MOAA/S) score assessments
Adverse event；Vital sign；Physical examination；Laboratory examination；ECG；The nervous system function test

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics/Dynamics Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment
